meanings.definition: A mark or note added to a text as a commentary or explanation.
meanings.sent1: The teacher's apostils in the margins helped me understand the story better.
meanings.sent2: She carefully added apostils to her essay to provide additional insights.
meanings.sent3: The playful apostils in the book made the reader smile.
meanings.sent4: His thoughtful apostils were like little gems scattered throughout the text.
meanings.sent5: The colorful apostils made the page come alive with explanations.

meanings.definition: A certificate issued by a competent authority authenticating a document for use in another country.
meanings.sent1: He needed an apostil to make his diploma valid abroad.
meanings.sent2: The embassy provided the necessary apostil for the legal document.
meanings.sent3: The missing apostil on the contract caused a humorous mix-up.
meanings.sent4: The apostil on the passport was the key to unlocking new opportunities.
meanings.sent5: The shiny apostil on the paper gleamed with official approval.
